stories.text:
I am approx. 3 years into my career as a Software Engineer and currently working for a start-up. I've begun conducting interviews recently and am feeling a level of imposter syndrome as often the candidates are further along in their careers than I am.

I'm conscious that as with other things, that with practise I will get better at it but would also be grateful for resources/advice for how to improve and ensure that I can add value to this process for the business, the candidates, and myself.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to Get Better as an Interviewer?

stories.text:
Imagine you have approximately 90 day warning that a disease with similar (or even slightly more dangerous) characteristics than Covid has started spreading in a far away part of world - as far away as Wuhan is from San Francisco.

Knowing what we know about Covid and civilization’s response to it - what will you do to protect yourself and your loved ones?

Some options: * move to an island? different country or jurisdiction? Which one? * move to a country house with food? Meds? Guns? Something else? * continue doing what you do? For it was not so bad?
stories.title: Ask HN: How will you prepare for a Covid-like disease in the future?
